R MarkdownThis is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com.
You can embed an R code chunk like this:
1summary(cars) 2## speed dist 3## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 4## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 5## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 6## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 7## 3rd Qu.
title: Hello R Markdown

subtitle:
This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are:
You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.
title: A Plain Markdown Post
